plugins.name: Renamer
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that helps you keep your layers organized by automatically generating descriptive names based on their properties. Perfect for maintaining clean and consistent layer naming across your designs.


Automatically renames layers based on their properties:

  1. Shows dimensions (width √ó height)
  2. Displays color information (HEX codes)
  3. Shows opacity values
  4. Indicates effects (shadows, blurs)
  5. Shows constraints
  6. Includes corner radius information
  7. Includes stroke details
  8. Reflects Auto Layout properties


Select layers and run the plugin to rename them according to your settings.

accepted.name: Pavel
accepted.description: Product designer with 5+ years of experience in web and mobile UI.

plugins.tagline: Smart & seamless layer renaming

131546.description:

plugins.name: Find & Replace Anything
plugins.description:
Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!


A powerful tool for finding and replacing styles! Works with components, instances and library styles. Especially helpful to align parameters across projects in bulk like auto layout or library styles for your pixel perfect design.


Plugin is in active development. Therefore, any feedback is appreciated! Like our plugin? Leave a heart!


Full feature list:


Library & local Styles

  1. Fonts
  2. Colors
  3. Effects
  4. Grids


Variables (search only)

  1. Color Variable
  2. Number Variable
  3. String Variable
  4. Boolean Variable


Shape & Frame

  1. Name
  2. Width
  3. Height
  4. Position X
  5. Position Y
  6. Rotation
  7. Constrain Proportions
  8. Clip content


Text

  1. Text
  2. Font Size
  3. Paragraphs Spacing
  4. Paragraph Indent
  5. Text Decoration
  6. Text Case
  7. Text Resizing
  8. Text Align Horizontal
  9. Text Align Vertical


Layer

  1. Blend Mode
  2. Opacity
  3. Visibility


Stroke

  1. Stroke Align
  2. Stroke Weight
  3. Stroke Join


Auto Layout

  1. Layout mode
  2. Spacing between items
  3. Paddings
plugins.tagline: Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!

plugins.name: Outset Pr Invoice Plugin
plugins.description:
Invoice Filler Plugin for Outset PR


This plugin is specifically designed for Outset PR and works exclusively with their internal invoice template in Figma. It automates the process of populating the template with data submitted via the plugin‚Äôs form, streamlining the invoicing workflow for the company.


How It Works:


The plugin is built to integrate with a single invoice template used by Outset PR.

Users submit invoice data through the plugin's form.

The plugin then automatically fills the predefined fields in the Outset PR invoice template within Figma.


Limitation for Reviewers:


Since the plugin is tailored for Outset PR's proprietary invoice template, reviewers will not have access to the template for testing.


For Figma Reviewers:


To review the functionality of the plugin, please use mock data in the form. The plugin will generate a dummy page with the entered data displayed.

If you are a member of the Figma team, please fill out the form and review the data generated by the plugin to understand its intended functionality.


Key Features:


Specifically designed for Outset PR‚Äôs invoice template, allowing users to quickly populate the template with the required data.

Simplifies the invoicing process for Outset PR by eliminating manual data entry.

Optimized for seamless integration with a single internal template used by the company.
plugins.tagline: A plugin to fill invoices

plugins.name: Export to Denada
plugins.description:
Effortlessly create, customize, and refine HTML emails in seconds with Denada. Your brand. Your voice. Your rules. It's like magic.


This plugin is the easiest way to export your Figma designs into Denada.


How to Export Images to Denada:


  1. In Figma, select a layer to export, then right-click > Plugins > Export to Denada
  2. Name the image, paste in Denada API Token then Export to Denada
  3. The exported image will now appear in your Denada image collection


The image is linked.


  1. If you alter your image on Figma, just export it again and click "update available" in Denada


How to get a Denada API Token:


  1. In Denada, go to Settings (User must be a manager or higher)
  2. Click Create Token, Name Token
  3. Copy Token
plugins.tagline: Export your Figma assets to Denada's image library, in one click.

121997.name: Export to Denada
121997.description:
Effortlessly create, customize, and refine HTML emails in seconds with Denada. Your brand. Your voice. Your rules. It's like magic.


This plugin is the easiest way to export your Figma designs into Denada.


How to Export Images to Denada:


  1. In Figma, select a layer to export, then right-click > Plugins > Export to Denada
  2. Name the image, paste in Denada API Token then Export to Denada
  3. The exported image will now appear in your Denada image collection


The image is linked.


  1. If you alter your image on Figma, just export it again and click "update available" in Denada


How to get a Denada API Token:


  1. In Denada, go to Settings (User must be a manager or higher)
  2. Click Create Token, Name Token
  3. Copy Token
121997.release_notes: Allow exporting any layer, not just Frame layers.
121997.tagline: Export your Figma assets to Denada's image library, in one click.

plugins.name: Figmata
plugins.description: Figmata is a tool that brings data visualization into the Figma environment, letting designers map data directly onto design elements with live, visual feedback. Unlike rigid chart tools like Excel or Illustrator, Figmata enables custom, flexible, and interactive graphics‚Äîintegrated into the design systems designers already use. It lowers the barrier to entry compared to D3 by working within Figma's component-based structure and offering code autocompletion for advanced users. Figmata supports CSV/JSON input, direct manipulation of visual properties, and saves state for iterative work. It bridges the gap between data and UI design, making data-rich interfaces more intuitive and design-friendly.
plugins.tagline: Data-driven design directly in Figma

130087.name: Figmata

It lowers the barrier to entry compared to D3 by working within Figma's component-based structure and offering code autocompletion for advanced users. Figmata supports CSV/JSON input, direct manipulation of visual properties, and saves state for iterative work. It bridges the gap between data and UI design, making data-rich interfaces more intuitive and design-friendly.

plugins.name: DevPlugin - Copy Disign
plugins.description:
DevPlugin is a plugin for fast migration of components.


DevPlugin automates the process of obtaining and implementing components into web projects. The plugin creates secure scripts based on the layout and allows you to use them on any external resources.


What he can do:

  1. Generating a custom JS script
  2. Personal account with subscription management and action history
  3. Data encryption and protection of user tokens


Fits:

  1. UI/UX designer
  2. Developers of landing pages and interfaces
  3. To the authors of design systems
plugins.tagline: We will help you transfer your design to the constructor with all the adaptive designs.

plugins.name: Maruco
plugins.description:
What is this?

Maruco is a plugin that provides rules and validation for component naming, helping you identify components that violate naming conventions and elements.


1. Selecting naming convention.

There are several conventions, let's select the best one for your project.


2. Entering naming elements.

Next, you can enter "words" that makes up the component's name.

Enter a comma between words to set multiple words.

Maruco guesses that the component's name is made up of three elements: a prefix, a middle word and a suffix.


3. Running validation.

That's all. Let's run the validation.
plugins.tagline: Effortless rule creation for component naming.

117124.name: Maruco
117124.description:
What is this?

Maruco is a plugin that provides rules and validation for component naming, helping you identify components that violate naming conventions and elements.


1. Selecting naming convention.

There are several conventions, let's select the best one for your project.


2. Entering naming elements.

Next, you can enter "words" that makes up the component's name.

Enter a comma between words to set multiple words.

Maruco guesses that the component's name is made up of three elements: a prefix, a middle word and a suffix.


3. Running validation.

That's all. Let's run the validation.
117124.tagline: Effortless rule creation for component naming.

plugins.name: Import CSS shadows, create Figma styles
plugins.description:
I recently needed to create a Figma file from an existing website, and manually setting up effects took too long, so I created this plugin.


You can paste a CSS box-shadow, preview it, then create a style from all the shadow values.


You can also create matching variables. There is a small caveat: the Figma plugin API does not allow you to connect the style with the variable from within the plugin itself, meaning the style is disconnected from the variable. It still saves a tonne of time though!

accepted.name: Luis Ouriach
accepted.description:
Design & community @figmadesign. I write a newsletter, manage and host @8pxmag. 

Hot sauce on everything.

plugins.tagline: Copy, paste, generate

135698.name: Import CSS shadows, create Figma styles
135698.description:
I recently needed to create a Figma file from an existing website, and manually setting up effects took too long, so I created this plugin.


You can paste a CSS box-shadow, preview it, then create a style from all the shadow values.


You can also create matching variables. There is a small caveat: the Figma plugin API does not allow you to connect the style with the variable from within the plugin itself, meaning the style is disconnected from the variable. It still saves a tonne of time though!

plugins.name: Panto: Rename Variables in a Snap!
plugins.description: Tired of manually renaming variable prefixes one by one? Panto is here to streamline your workflow! This powerful yet simple plugin allows you to batch rename the initial segment of your Figma variable names.
plugins.tagline: Batch Rename Variables, Simplified

134630.name: Panto: Rename Variables in a Snap!
134630.description: Tired of manually renaming variable prefixes one by one? Panto is here to streamline your workflow! This powerful yet simple plugin allows you to batch rename the initial segment of your Figma variable names.

plugins.name: Tailwind Text Styles Generator
plugins.description:
Tailwind Text Style Generator is a Figma plugin that helps you automatically generate text styles from Google Fonts, based on Tailwind typography scale.


Tired of manually creating text styles and organizing layers one by one? This plugin does it all for you:


üé® Choose from 1,800+ Google Fonts

üìè Auto-generate Text Styles using Tailwind-friendly sizing (sm, base, lg, xl, etc.)

‚ö° Perfect for dev-design alignment especially for teams using Tailwind CSS

üìÅ Organized neatly: styles are grouped and named by scale

üîÅ Try different fonts freely great for experimenting and iterating

üíæ Instantly saved into your current design system


Whether you're building a design system or just want to speed up your workflow, this plugin makes it seamless, scalable, and developer-friendly.
plugins.tagline: 1.800 Fonts. 1 Click. Done.

plugins.name: Fijira
plugins.description:
Streamline your workflow and eliminate the gap between design and project management with Fijira. This powerful plugin seamlessly connects your Figma designs directly to your Jira tickets, ensuring that your development team always has access to the latest frames, feedback, and design specifications.


Stop wasting time manually exporting assets and pasting links. With Fijira, you can create detailed Jira comments, update ticket statuses, and link specific Figma frames directly from within your design file.


Key Features:


One-Click Jira Comments: Create rich, formatted comments in Jira tickets directly from Figma.

Automatic Frame Linking: Automatically attach a link to your selected Figma frame. If no frame is selected, you have the option to paste a link manually.

Status Updates: View available transitions and update the status of your Jira tickets without leaving Figma.

Simple Markdown Editor: Format your comments with bold, italics, lists, and links to keep your communication clear and organized.

Secure & Private: Your Jira credentials are saved securely in your local Figma storage and are never exposed. All communication happens through a secure, private proxy server.

Easy Setup: A simple, one-time setup for your Jira domain, email, and API token gets you started in minutes.

How to Use:


Run the Plugin: Open Fijira from the plugins menu.

Enter Your Settings: In the settings view, enter your Jira domain (e.g., your-company.atlassian.net), your Jira account email, and a valid Jira API token.

Select a Frame (Optional): Select a single frame in your Figma file that you want to link.

Fill in Commit Details: In the commit view, enter a commit title, a detailed description (using the markdown editor!), and the target Jira issue key (e.g., PROJ-123).

Update Status (Optional): Choose a new status for your Jira ticket from the dropdown menu.

Commit! Click "Commit & Update Jira". Fijira will post your comment, link, and status change to the specified Jira ticket and create a new version in your Figma file history.

Say goodbye to context switching and hello to a more efficient workflow with Fijira!
plugins.tagline: Sync your Figma designs with Jira issue, seamlessly.

plugins.name: Padding Scaler
plugins.description:
Padding Scaler helps designers rapidly create compact, default, and spacious layout variants by scaling the vertical paddings of auto-layout frames.


Instead of editing each value manually, simply select your frames, choose a scale (0.5√ó to 4√ó), and instantly apply consistent spacing changes.


Ideal for testing different density modes or aligning with design system spacing tokens.


‚ú® Features:


Works with one or many auto-layout frames


Choose vertical, horizontal, or both directions


Fast, intuitive UI with live scaling preview


Save time, stay consistent, and iterate layout decisions faster.
plugins.tagline: Instantly scale vertical and/or horizontal paddings in auto-layout frames to test density modes.

134488.tagline: Instantly scale vertical and/or horizontal paddings in auto-layout frames to test density modes.

plugins.name: Radical: Gradient Background Generator
plugins.description: Generate beautiful gradient backgrounds. Gradients are vector-based, scalable to any resolution. Control colors, background, blur amount, etc. The last Gradient Generator you'll ever need!
plugins.tagline: Generate beautiful gradient backgrounds with customizable colors & blend modes.

134179.name: Radical: Gradient Background Generator
134179.description: Generate beautiful gradient backgrounds. Gradients are vector-based, scalable to any resolution. Control colors, background, blur amount, etc. The last Gradient Generator you'll ever need!
134179.release_notes: Now, frames will generate at 1920x1080 regardless of zoom level; when user is zoomed way out, the blur amount wasn't sufficient. Now when a frame is generated it will always be at the set blur level - then the user can scale to any size they prefer.
134179.tagline: Generate beautiful gradient backgrounds with customizable colors & blend modes.

plugins.name: Section Auto-Resize with 200px Margin
plugins.description:
This plugin automatically resizes Figma Sections to fit their content and adds a 200px margin around the content area. It's designed to help teams maintain consistent spacing and layout rules without manually adjusting section boundaries.


Perfect for teams working with grid systems, spacing standards, or design system alignment workflows.
plugins.tagline: Auto-resize sections and apply consistent 200px margin padding.

plugins.name: Hotkey
plugins.description:
Hotkey lets you control Figma layouts entirely from your keyboard using simple shortcuts. Quickly move, resize, and adjust constraints without opening any panels. Chain commands for efficient workflows. Designed for speed and minimal distraction. Works on selected layers; some features depend on Figma‚Äôs API limits.


Read the Docs here: https://navaneethvenu.notion.site/Hotkey-Plugin-1f4ef6c3905a80349201f06119dfeb04?pvs=4


If you have any further questions or need assistance, join our discord server or our telegram community.
plugins.tagline: Hotkey is a keyboard-first Figma plugin for fast layout control using shortcuts and commands.

135952.name: Hotkey
135952.description:
Hotkey lets you control Figma layouts entirely from your keyboard using simple shortcuts. Quickly move, resize, and adjust constraints without opening any panels. Chain commands for efficient workflows. Designed for speed and minimal distraction. Works on selected layers; some features depend on Figma‚Äôs API limits.


Read the Docs here: https://navaneethvenu.notion.site/Hotkey-Plugin-1f4ef6c3905a80349201f06119dfeb04?pvs=4


If you have any further questions or need assistance, join our discord server or our telegram community.
135952.release_notes:
Commands:
1. New Increase/Decrease Width & Height Commands: Use +h, -h, +w, and -w to dynamically adjust height and width values relative to current dimensions.

Other Changes:
1. Added support for + and - prefixes in command parsing (e.g., +h12, -w8) and updated internal regex handling accordingly.
135952.tagline: Hotkey is a keyboard-first Figma plugin for fast layout control using shortcuts and commands.

plugins.name: LayAuto Plugin
plugins.description:
LayAuto is a responsive SVG layout generator that creates customizable grid-based designs with text and images, perfect for quick visual mockups and design assets.


This Figma plugin imports LayAuto designs by converting the SVG code into accurately positioned Figma elements, while preserving multiline text, shapes, and styling.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly bring LayAuto designs into Figma.

131585.name: LayAuto Plugin
131585.description:
LayAuto is a responsive SVG layout generator that creates customizable grid-based designs with text and images, perfect for quick visual mockups and design assets.


This Figma plugin imports LayAuto designs by converting the SVG code into accurately positioned Figma elements, while preserving multiline text, shapes, and styling.
131585.tagline: Seamlessly bring LayAuto designs into Figma.

plugins.name: SuperLayer (copy)
plugins.description:
SuperLayer (copy) lets you quickly view and copy the names of selected layers in your Figma file or FigJam board. It‚Äôs ideal for generating UI inventories, documentation, or simply organizing your layer structure. The plugin also shows each layer‚Äôs type and a thumbnail preview when available.


To use it, select one or more layers on your canvas and launch the plugin. A clean list view will appear with sorting options and checkboxes to include or exclude layers. Click the Copy button to copy all selected layer names to your clipboard, formatted line by line. The list updates automatically as you change your selection.


SuperLayer is optimized for speed and simplicity. It does not currently support exporting full metadata, nested hierarchy structures, or annotations. Thumbnails are generated when possible, but may not appear for certain FigJam elements or complex Figma nodes.
plugins.tagline: Copy Figma and FigJam layer names with ease. Sortable and perfect for docs, audits, and checklists

131488.name: SuperLayer (copy)
131488.description:

To use it, select one or more layers on your canvas and launch the plugin. A clean list view will appear with sorting options and checkboxes to include or exclude layers. Click the Copy button to copy all selected layer names to your clipboard, formatted line by line. The list updates automatically as you change your selection.


SuperLayer is optimized for speed and simplicity. It does not currently support exporting full metadata, nested hierarchy structures, or annotations. Thumbnails are generated when possible, but may not appear for certain FigJam elements or complex Figma nodes.
131488.tagline: Copy Figma and FigJam layer names with ease. Sortable and perfect for docs, audits, and checklists

plugins.name: SaveFrame - Save, Share, and Manage Custom Frames with Ease.
plugins.description:
SaveFrame ‚Äî Figma Frames, Re imagined!


Tired of Figma‚Äôs default frame window? SaveFrame is your modern visual command center for everything frames.

Custom frames, Organize, preview, customize, delete, and share‚Äîlike never before.


Whether you're documenting designs, building moodboards, or curating visual systems, SaveFrame gives you full creative control. It's what Figma frames should feel like.


‚ú® Why designers love SaveFrame:


üîç Instant Frame Previews

  1. No more clicking around. See all your frames at a glance in a clean, scrollable UI.

üß© Drag & Drop Organization

  1. Sort, group, and build collections effortlessly. Your canvas, your logic.

üßπ Smart Deletion

  1. Clear out what you don‚Äôt need‚Äîinstantly. Delete single frames or full sets with confidence.

üìê Save All the Details

  1. Dimensions, effects, layout, constraints‚ÄîSaveFrame remembers the stuff that matters.

üé® Reusable Frame Presets

  1. Create your own frame styles and apply them in one click. Keep your design patterns consistent.

üöÄ Seamless Sharing

  1. Export and import frame collections in seconds.
  2. Perfect for sharing with teammates or individuals‚Äîno friction, no confusion.

‚≠ê Favorite Key Frames

  1. Highlight your best work and access it instantly when it counts.

üåó Light & Dark Mode

  1. A workspace that adapts to your vibe, day or night.



üõ† Built for designers who:

  1. Want more control than Figma gives out of the box
  2. Create and manage multiple frames daily
  3. Build moodboards, docs, and design systems
  4. Hate clutter and love visual clarity
  5. Need a fast way to share organized frames with collaborators


In short:

We took the idea of Figma frames and made it flexible, collaborative, and creator-first.

SaveFrame isn‚Äôt just a tool‚Äîit‚Äôs a better way to work with frames.
plugins.tagline: Figma Frames, Reimagined ‚Äî Save, Share, and Manage Custom Frames with Ease.

plugins.name: figma-text-css
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you extract CSS styles from a selected text layer in Figma.

Get accurate font-weight, font-size, color, line-height, and letter-spacing instantly, formatted in pure CSS.


Perfect for developers and designers who want a fast way to turn styled text into usable web code.


üí° Features:

- Auto-generate CSS for font properties

- RGB to HEX color conversion

- Automatically cleans text by removing line breaks

- Works on selection change for a smooth workflow
plugins.tagline: Instantly copy font styles as CSS

129749.name: figma-text-css
129749.description:

üí° Features:

- RGB to HEX color conversion

- Automatically cleans text by removing line breaks

- Works on selection change for a smooth workflow
129749.release_notes: font-family is intentionally omitted from the CSS output. You can manually add it if needed.
129749.tagline: Instantly copy font styles as CSS

plugins.name: Replacer
plugins.description:
You select the object / component in figma and run this plugin.

For color groups: It automatically scans for "groups" and will do it's best to replace it with color variables that share the same naming structure.

For color variables, or plain colors: You select the color / variable to be replaced (target) and select the color to replace it with (source).

Done.

‚òë Panel will remember what function you used last time.

‚òë Works with gradient stops, colors in text fields and drop/inner shadows.
plugins.tagline: Replaces colors based on their "group" or per link to a color variable.

127834.name: Replacer

Done.

‚òë Panel will remember what function you used last time.

‚òë Works with gradient stops, colors in text fields and drop/inner shadows.
127834.release_notes: Added a "Delete" button to remove selected styles
127834.tagline: Replaces colors based on their "group" or per link to a color variable.

plugins.name: Round Width to 8
plugins.description:
Make your designs cleaner and more consistent with this simple plugin that rounds the width of selected elements up to the next multiple of 8. Great for enforcing 8px spacing systems, aligning to design tokens, or preparing components for dev handoff.


Just select one or more resizable elements and run the plugin ‚Äî no UI, no fuss.
plugins.tagline: Rounds element widths up to the next multiple of 8 ‚Äî clean, consistent, and dev-ready.

127315.name: Round Width to 8
127315.description:

Just select one or more resizable elements and run the plugin ‚Äî no UI, no fuss.
127315.tagline: Rounds element widths up to the next multiple of 8 ‚Äî clean, consistent, and dev-ready.

plugins.name: Round Off
plugins.description:
This plugin helps avoid the Figma export bug where any decimal values in a frame's position values are are rounded up on export, resulting in a subpixel white line on the sides of your exported PNGs.


Apply to all top-level frames or to just to frames selected and remove all decimal values from the x and y positions before export.


Never see that white line again!
plugins.tagline: Avoid PNG export bugs by rounding off all decimals from your top level frames' position values.

130230.name: Round Off
130230.description:

Never see that white line again!
130230.tagline: Avoid PNG export bugs by rounding off all decimals from your top level frames' position values.

plugins.name: ToCode
plugins.description:
This is a small plugin for design-to-code conversion


Process: After the user clicks on the design draft, the plugin will automatically convert it into html code and it can be run in codesandbox
